Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your dollar/CLEAN and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: pgrobitaille
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bed room, gorgeous room, great quality for the dollar and very cheap in price. Very nice clean updated furnishings and carpets, good sized bathroom. Very pleasant staff...an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we needed it for”
Reviews.Author: Nikita42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January on our way to New Orleans for a cruise. We booked it through our travel agent and paid $99 for the first night and $89 for our second night on returning. We left our vehicle there and no damage was done. Hotel room was average but bathroom was a little shabby. Wallpaper was peeling in spots. Room was clean and the beds comfortable. Unlike others, we actually lucked out on our return with the shuttle as we only waited about 10 min. However, others waiting said they had been there for over 30 min. There is a Kelsey's restaurant located right beside the hotel where we had supper the first night. On our return trip we ate at the Casey's restaurant right in the hotel which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Airport travellers”
Reviews.Author: kipmunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge at Toronto airport while traveling to Costa Rica. We left our vehicles there and had a room going and returning, the rooms were clean and the vehicle safe. They have a Casey's right in the hotel, so we had breakfast there going and coming. Our waitress Diane was one of the best I have ever been served by, she was friendly and effiicient, a real geunuinely nice lady. The desk staff were helpful and explained clearly when we had a question. We would use this location again. David & Kerry Jones Sudbury Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but terrible parking and shuttle”
Reviews.Author: lskinner6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the park and stay package. No problems on our first night stay and then shuttle to airport. Arriving at the airport however, service was terrible. We were informed that once we arrived back from our trip we were to call number on a card they gave us and they would come pick us up. This was not the case. We called and were told the shuttle comes every half hour and to wait at a spot outside. They could not give us an estimated tiime and because we came back from somewhere warm we were freezing waiting outside. We had to wait 35 minutes for our shuttle while we saw other hotel shuttles come in that time 2-3 times. Once on the shuttle we were told it would not take us to the overflow parking that we had to park our car at. So we had to unload and wait at the hotel for another shuttle to come pick us up from the hotel to shuttle us to the lot. Do not book if you are planning on leaving your car here.

Reviews.Title: “Scalding shower”
Reviews.Author: s2pigeau
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with this location.While the room price was decent and the lobby looked nice enough, the same can't be said once your reach the floor levels. They definitely need updating there. Carpet has seen better days. Plus, there was no cold water in the bathroom which caused for a near scalding shower. Let the front desk know on the 1st morning. On 2nd day, had cold water when 1st turned on tub, got in shower and nearly scalded myself again. Mainentenace had been up to check and fix it. Fail! I think it's a problem with the whole hotel as spoke with 2 other travellers and they had he same issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grand Foyer; crappy rooms and cust. treatment”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the beginning of a snowstorm on Friday Feb 10th 2012 after a 5 hr drive. My bride felt good so we didn't bother booking an "accessible" room. In retrospect we should have!!! The lady at the counter(to save her a** I won't write her name) made it a point to make us uncomfortable and feeling cheap. I called the 1-800-travelodge number to book a room as we were going to a company training as we do about once a month for the last 18 months or so with this company but we have been going to that Travelodge for about 8 years now about 3-4 times a year. We got an excellent price compared to usually and were quite content... until we checked in!! The cart was in sorry shape so bringing in our lugage was a rough job. Not sure why but the counter person treated us like dirt and like we didn't even deserve being in a room "at that price"! I requested a fridge for my bride's medication when I booked the room and was told by the counter person that at the price we were paying there was no fridge in the room and not to expect one unless we paid for it. I found this weird because at all other times there was no problem and no charge if it was "for medical reasons"! However, we managed with ice before and we did again! Had the training not been at that hotel we would have left right there and then. We get to the room and it is ok but more than likely one of the worst of the hotel(I hope so!).Tiles falling off the wall base in the washroom, absolutely no extras and loose plumbing in the shower/tub enclosure(I've mentioned this in previous reviews but they still have not repaired it). There is a coffeemaker however it is not plugged in and not even near a plug so you have to move the tv wall unit or move it to plug it in the bathroom!?! Hey Travelodge: at least install an extension so it can be plugged in where it sits! Another item I've mentioned a few times already is the complete lack of proper lighting! 2 WEAK CFL bulbs in lamps with damaged lampshades are not enough for most baby boomers and unless you go in the bathroom to read at night good luck! The exercise room is clean but a lot of the equipment is in need of repair or very old and decrepit. Unfortunately the pool is still relying on chlorine instead of saltwater and that should be changed asap please Travelodge. On the positive side, the flat screen tv offers an excellent(if somewhat dark) picture and there are many channels to choose from. The heating/ac works very well and the king size bed is totally comfortable. Room was quiet even though planes were flying at eye level from our 3rd floor room. Our conference room was very clean and setup perfectly and all other staff was awesome! Upon checkout, we found counter staff very pleasant and eager to help UNLIKE the staff person at check-in. The Casey's restaurant within the hotel is probably the most "fun" of all Casey's we've been to and they have good food at fair prices albeit somewhat slow service. Of special note: it was very bad outside with the snowstorm and the entrance was quite slippery. We saw many people "slip and save" but extra carpets would alleviate this problem entirely. Staff tries very hard to keep the area safe with mops and signs but be very careful when it is wet or snowy outside. I rated it average but it is really below average except for the beautiful foyer and the mostly friendly staff(most of the time). Rooms are dated and in need of freshening and sorely in need of proper lighting(most likely to hide the flaws)! Wi-fi is included in rooms and all over hotel and very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “no hot water, oversold the parking”
Reviews.Author: Oplacesyoullgo
Reviews.Content: The Keg next door is great. The rooms are extremely tired (large burns from an iron in the carpet). We had an early and long flight the next day but there was no hot water in our room. Advised the front desk who said he'd "leave a note". We asked about a room rate reduction and he refused and said there wasn't a manager available. The parking lot was full so he sent us to the park n fly and gave us vouchers. Upon our return, the vouchers did not work as promised so it took some time with the security guy at midnight to help us sort it out. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport- shuttle included”
Reviews.Author: chantal8821
Reviews.Content: Shuttle picked us up at airport....every 20-30 min shuttle. Very close to airport so very accomodating. restaurant The Keg next door . very good food and atmosphere Hotel rooms clean and big. Only downer they didnt leave the fireplace on in the lobby during the evening so it took away the warm xmas atmosphere that we could have enjoyed. The lobby was cold. They had a huge xmas tree in lobby which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we left for our vacation and again on our way back. What a mistake we made booking at this place. The shuttle from the airport was late both times even though we called the hotel to request a pickup. The first time it was -20C outside and we didn't have any of our winter clothing on because we were going to the Caribbean. On our way back, our flight came in at 2am so we were VERY tired and just wanted to go to sleep. We and other guests called the hotel a few times to ask about the shuttle and they were very rude. When it finally did show up, the driver didn't even help us with our luggage. Then, when we arrived at the hotel, the very rude and unprofessional female security guard gave us a hassle because we didn't have wristbands on (I guess you needed them because it was New Year's Eve) and asked us if we were even guests at the hotel. Yes lady - we like to walk around the airport hotel strip during the winter with no warm clothing, lugging suitcases in the middle of the night on NYE. Thank you for making us feel so welcome. Then when she did put the wristbands on us, she just about cut circulation off it was so tight. Our travel agent requested a late checkout for us because of our flight times, which was not honoured at the hotel. We were told it was their policy (according to the guy who walked out of the back room, looked at us, and then told us it was their policy) to offer late checkout on New Year's Day. There was nothing posted saying that was the policy and we even offered to pay extra for it. Security was heavy that night and they were being extremely dramatic about it being NYE and all and that they had to keep things under control. I found that extremely ironic because on our way out the next day, we saw the huge sign advertising their "great rates for walk-ins on NYE!" If it's going to cause so many problems, don't advertise it at the expense of quiet guests just looking to mind their business and sleep in a little bit during their vacation. A bunch of drunks on NYE aren't likely to be your repeat customers, travelers are... but not these ones. I'd rather pay double than stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: bgbro777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Toronto Airport Hotel and let me tell you something what a mistake. The rooms are smelly and the furniture, TV and carpets date back in 1975. The remote control for the TV works in Slomotion, I asked the front desk guy for a wake-up call at 8:30 A.M. and guess what my wake-up call came in at 6:30 A.M. Seriously dude where do you think we live in Russia. I will never stay at the Travelodge Toronto Airport Hotel again, I would rather sleep outside in the fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: benni_wintergerst
Reviews.Content: Very good budget option for Toronto. spacious rooms, great Spa area, and a bus stop right in front of the door also a few restaurant are nearby ( italian, mexican, oriental ) once again the price is allmost unbeatable for what you get ( about 75 CAD per night ) but dont take the bussiness room with breakfast, this is not worth the extra money...its only coffee and muffin for 10 CAD extra

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: lenfromsturgeon
Reviews.Content: Amazing fast check in and very nice room (for the price). I wanted to just soak in a hot bath but there was no hot water. They sent up maintenance and I was told that alot of people were showering probably and to try in 1/2 an hour. I waited for 3 hours and no luck. I finally called the front desk and before you can say Bob's your uncle, they had me in another room with very hot water. Thanks so much for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, incredibly friendly staff, room bathrooms need attention”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby it is very impressive. The friendly and helpful staff always do their best to make sure you get all the attention you need. I've written about this hotel before so I'll write about a sore point more than usual: I've mentioned this to the desk staff a few times now so her e it is again: Hello Travelodge!!! FIX THE BATHROOM PLUMBING ALREADY!! Every tap is loose/hard to operate and the shower head feed from the wall is completely loose. I understand you can't have a plumber on hand 24/7 but I'm willing to say publicly than within a week, if you hired one to simply tighten all handles, taps, shower heads, your guests' stay would be al the more pleasant. Had I had a multi-tool I would have tightened the shower water control knob myself in about 1 minute. Everyone who stays there already knows there is a need for updating but why not keep everything up and at least make it look like you are trying?!? In this day and age of consumer awareness what's with the chlorinated pool?Saltwater instead of chlorine is way safer and so much easier for upkeep; it would also give us some kind of indication that you are trying to keep up to date. I must say the pillows were way better than all other times I've been there(every 2-3 months). Thanks for putting normal(thinner) pillows. I slept more comfortably. the mattress was very comfortable as usual and even though the television set is outdated the picture is very clear and it works well. The reason for my "average" rating of rooms is the poor condition of bathroom plumbing and old style TV.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean...”
Reviews.Author: Imanewf55
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I was attending a seminar nearby and it offered both a very good rate and a free shuttle to the airport. The bedroom is very sparsely furnished and certainly the decor is dated. I do not like the fact that the windows do not open and in order to have any air I left the AC running all night. It was very noisy. A little more light would have been appreciated also. Nothing surprised me. It is a basic hotel. In it's favour, I will say the bed was comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but needs renovation....”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge for one night and here are my pros & cons: Pros: - Good location near Toronto Pearson airport with free shuttle - Good choice of restaurants around with Caseys inside the hotel - Friendly staff Cons: - Rooms (as well as the hotel itself...) are WAY OUTDATED!!!! Old furniture, Old TV, weird smell. It looked like a hotel room straight from the 1970's! In summary, I would suggest this hotel only if you are REALLY price-conscious...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good basic options”
Reviews.Author: Aviatorstarboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convienently located to the Toronto International Airport with a shuttle every 30 minutes on the hour and 1/2 from the arrivals area Zone P7 at the end of the hotel shuttle area. The hotel is a 17 story tower over looking the airport, with a 17th floor Executive lounge available for breakfast for those who pay for the extra option of it. The building is in general good repair, clean with a pool, well equipped weight/fitness room and meeting rooms. There is a restaurant, and gift shop in the lobby, and three elevators ensure you will not wait long for your trip up or down. There are other fast food and more expensive eating options around the hotel, as well as Aviaton World Gift shop for the flight minded. There is a bus stop outside the hotel which is convienent for trips to down town Toronto which take about an hour connecting with the Subway (the Rocket) Generally the front desk staff are good, however like other hotels, some can be less than helpful to get opinions and or directions. Parking is convienient, as are the two transit options to get to downtown Toronto. Good pick when staying long or short in the YYZ Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking that left a lasting Impression”
Reviews.Author: Valibro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with the 2 kids checked out of the hilton because our room reeked of vomit and were told we werent able to change rooms....we then booked a room with travelodge because everywhere else was sold out being that it was "Caribana" weekend. We have never stayed at a travelodge and didnt know what to expect but I must say from check in to check out ....our stay was EXCELLENT....the only downside was the hot tub was closed but other than that we blown away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Completely family friendly”
Reviews.Author: tingtong1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife. The hotel is quite conveniently located just outside the airport (about < 10 min drive from the airport rental car locations). The hotel staff was courteous. I had reserved a King bed room. The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. The carpet had some stains but it was largely non-problematic. The bathroom was clean. Had slight issues with the temperature of the water in the bath tub, however, it being summer, this was again a non-issue. The room didn't have a refrigerator. We were given free internet wi-fi access in the room as promised. There is a restaurant 'Casey's' right inside the restaurant which is open quite late in the night. It has good options for breakfast, dinner, etc. We were even given a 10% discount upon paying the bill in the restaurant itself (they also had an option of being billed to the room directly). Overall a very nice stay and I would love to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Holoboss
Reviews.Content: It was third time we used this hotel. It is just 10 minutes drive by free shuttle, so it is quite convenient. For the price (we found on-line deal around $85) it was an excellent value. Room was clean, inexpensive restaurant located within hotel's grounds, free in-room internet, free shuttle - and a nice, friendly service. Nothing very fancy, but all was well, and for such price it was just great. Just recently we tried Gateway Hotel right at the airport - and our room was significantly less pleasant (and dirty!), staff less friendly - for double the money. So, if you can spend extra 20 minutes to get there from airport (free pickup from all terminals), it is a decent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Location”
Reviews.Author: ChristyBrown1974
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto with our 2 children. It was our 1st vacation. The hotel was nice & clean. My kids LOVED the pool & we were the only ones there each night. The on-site parking was convenient and the shuttle to the airport was great, too. We ordered room service which was a bit slow, but delicious. In the lobby there were a lot of great brochures & tourist information. The beds were comfortable & the housekeeping was wonderful. They picked up my kids stuffed animals daily and laid them neatly on the bed. We will definately use this hotel again! We didn't find the high speed internet too bad. It was better than nothing! The parking was much cheaper than hotels downtown. We paid $12/day upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2140
Reviews.Content: Nice property- easy to find! Good parking...Casey's on-site was great! Room was spacious! No complaints- we will be back next month!!

Reviews.Title: “Great access to airport, poor for city center access”
Reviews.Author: mfobbs
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time in Toronto, but spent more time than I wished traveling from this hotel to various locations downtown. Connecting with public transportation was simple but time-consuming. But getting back to the airport at the conclusion of my trip was amazingly quick and easy! Kudos for a good shuttle system. The main perk in the room was a lovely brick wall on one side. It made it feel like a rustic environment rather than sterile and generic. The lobby was beautiful, with lots of comfy chairs and wi-fi access. Not incredibly fast wi-fi, but decent. The restaurant, Casey's Bar and Grill, is the true gem of the Travelodge. Yes, it's expensive, but the staff is attentive, the chef prepared some awesome dishes, and the bar area was really fun. I wish the table areas were a bit brighter lit, but it's not a big flaw. My mahi-mahi was perfectly cooked. I had a great omelette one morning, and a tasty burger with incredibly good sweet potato fries the next.

Reviews.Title: “Slowest WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Freedom50plus
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel a number of times as a convenience for our needs. The front desk staff have always been great and accommodating. This time we noticed that the hotel is starting to show it's age. Furniture an carpet in our room were very weary. WiFi was one of the slowest that we've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great lobby & restaurant; don't expect much from rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love going there because it's near everything and that is why we hold many of our conferences/trainings there. Can't really trust the airport shuttle schedule though. The lobby will simply enchant the first timer and it remains a beautiful area for sitting, chatting by a fireplace, when you return. Desk staff do their best to help although the evening staff seems to be more "of service" than the day staff. I can't believe that a hotel of that size has only ONE accessible room(yes, it was booked)! We managed because my bride was having good days but had she not, it would have been very arduous. Not sure why but depending on who is at the desk, parking rates vary from free to $13.00 This time we got a 2nd fl. small(ish) room but the bathroom was in serious need of renos!! The fan was so noisy I literally opened it up and disconnected the motor so we wouldn't disturb the neighbours at night. I replugged it before leaving and notified the desk staff at checkout. Eco friendly lighting is a great train to be on but, believe me hotel owners, It plays HAVOC with baby boomer eyes!! The lighting in our room actually sucked and I had to sit under the corner lamp to be able to read my book. C'mon! Give us at least one bright light and put it on a dimmer! Back to the washroom: the shower plumbing is in very sorry state and everything needs to be replaced/recaulked and the shower head is no good for anyone shorter than 5 ft; it sprays too high. I wouldn't be surprised if there was a leak below becasue of the gap betwenn shower wall and the bath faucet. Beds are excellent and comfortable but there are no drawers anywhere. There is a closet, a small round table, a suitcase caddy and a corner unit with a tv (the remote buttons were always sticking and you have to aim it perfectly for it to work!) There is a coffee machine in the corner unit but no place to plug it in!! Moved it to the bathroom counter to use it. for the bargain basement price they charge for no refunds, no changes, no cancellations I guess it's ok but many other places nearby can match the price and comfort - of course, you wouldn't get the Casey's right inside and that alone is a big plus! Good food, fun/friendly staff and always busy.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough hotel, but don't count on the complimentary shuttle from hotel or direct flight”
Reviews.Author: jmj30
Reviews.Content: stayed here before a 6:15 flight. hotel and staff were great. casey's was good for dinner. when we took our vehicle to park it for the week they said they didn't have any spaces within the compound so sent us to a lot behind an abandoned warehouse down the street. after a few phone calls and frustration we ended up leaving it there but was very nervous. When we walked throught the hole in the fence throught the compound to get back to the hotel there were at least 7 spots available. Our truck was fine when we got back. When we called them from the airport to pick us up THEY TOOK FOREVER. should have taken a taxi. two vans came half full, so only a couple of people were able to get on, and did not return for at least 50 minutes. Never again. The shuttle to the airport in the morning from the travel lodge was crazy. whet down to the lobby and there were way too many people to fit into ONE SHUTTLE that leaves every 1/2 so many, many people were forced to call a taxi. Bottom line is don't offer a free shuttle if you can't accommodate all of your guests. For that reason will not use this hotel to stay park and fly again. Direct flight parking is a joke as well.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: blacknbluejeep
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a park n fly deal, got a decent rate for being so close to the airport. The parking for the park n fly is at a lot off site of the hotel, but its very close. Quick effecient transfer to the airport. We paid for a basic room, but when we checked in we recieved a room on a private floor, we recieved a very large room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the budget bill”
Reviews.Author: Signal50
Reviews.Content: Got a decent rate and a very comfortable stay at the Travelodge on Dixon Road, near the Toronto Airport. Good value and close to the Toronto Congress Centre where my event was held. The lobby was very well appointed - not your typical Traveledge. Casey's Restaurant on site. Nice wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Stay - Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Agent226
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a Park & Stay package. My flight was early in the morning, and the price worked out to be almost the same if I parked in the Park N Fly lots. I booked an executive suite because I wanted the breakfast to be included. I had a great sleep before my Cuba trip and started the day right with a buffet breakfast of baked goods, breads, cereals, waffles, fruit, and juices and coffee. I lounged around in my room until it was about time for check in and then leisurely made my way to the airport shuttle. My only complaint would be that the Front Desk didn't tell me where the shuttle would be picking up from at the Terminal. But otherwise great experience and will definitely book again here with the Executive suite.

Reviews.Title: “OK airpot hotel”
Reviews.Author: junglyhh
Reviews.Content: I guess everybody who stay there because of a long layover at the airport. The room is old but still clean. I stayed there just after coming back from vacation in Southeastern Asia, so comparing to the hotels there this one is really shabby. But if you understand this is in North America and you only pay $50~60 and you only need a bed to sleep, then it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “you can do better”
Reviews.Author: doobie11
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel pretty last minute as a stopover for an early morning flight. Arrived around 11:00 pm. Room was very basic, but seemed clean enough (lighting was dim). Bathroom not horrible, but not great. WAter pressure in the shower was terrible. The worst was the front desk service. We wanted to print our boarding passes before we got to the airport. there is a little computer beside the front desk where you can find your airline and print your passes for free. Nice touch, except our airline was not listed. Every other airline in the world probably was. We were flying Sunwing. Now this is not the hotel's fault, but I stood there at 11:20 at night waiting patiently for the one front desk guy to check in two ladies, which took about 20 minutes, no exaggeration. He never looked at me once, even though I was standing almost right beside him and just needed to ask a quick question. When he was done with the other two ladies, I asked him if he could help me. He responded "no". What?? So I asked him if there was someone else around who might know anything about this program. He responded "no". Not, "oh I'm sorry but I'm the only one here". Just "no". So I said, "how about a manager?". He said "there's no manager this late at night". So I said "well, can you check in the back if anyone else might be able to help me". He responded "it's a new program and we don't know anything about it". Well, it's in your hotel, you should know something about it. He reluctantly got someone else to come out and look, and she took a brief look at the computer and said "I don't know, you can try printing them in the business centre downstairs". How do I do that? Well, I have to go back up to the 7th floor and get my credit card, and then back down to below the lobby level, to print two boarding passes for 50 cents each. This is at almost 11:45 pm and I have to be up at 3:15 am. Needless to say, I didn't do it. While I somewhat understand if someone didn't know the program (although as I mentioned earlier - it's in your hotel, you should know something about it), it was the attitude of the employees that really ticked me off. Just a "no, can't help you". Even a "sorry" thrown in there would have sounded much better. For the price, you can find much nicer hotels in the area. WE paid $99 and that included the free shuttle. ON the way home, the shuttle took a long time to come to the airport to pick us up. We called upon arrival and they said they were on their way. Not so. Wouldn't recommend or go again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, period.”
Reviews.Author: s2steeda
Reviews.Content: Stopped here quickly for a layover, airport shuttle, which is free, came once in the hour, not every 10-15 minutes like we were told. Quick checkin, free internet which was very nice, upon getting to the room, my god, stained carpet, extremely small room, brick backing wall to bed with tons of holes drilled into it, extremely small and old TV, bathroom very old and a very strange toilet, don't ask. Hotel is in some serious need of renovations, like extremely needed. Ok for a quick stop but don't stay here more then one night, quite filthy. On a good note, the restaurant downstairs off the lobby was incredible, extremely good food and super hospitality, very recommended if you need a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gingermrs
Reviews.Content: stayed here 1 night during a trip to toronto to meet my husbands parents from the airport. i have stayed in alot better travelodges.... ill start with the good: nice enough lobby, helpful enough staff and a great shop on site. the rest: where we booked through told us the parking was free, it is not. our room was very outdated. big iron burn on the floor, not great sheets and old looking bathroom. AC unit was the loudest thing EVER. turned it off to go to sleep as it was so loud but woke up in the night boiling. had to have it on the rest of the night and didnt sleep well at all. could hear planes abit, but not that much. I think for the money we paid, we could have found somewhere better.and will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Price is not on par with sleep or quality of ameities.”
Reviews.Author: caspeyCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the airport you can hear every plane take off. If you like cold showers you will be in luck. The sinks and showers only have hot or cold water its one or the other. I took my laptop to use in the room but the only plug was in the bathroom. The free internet is ok if your high speed modem is pluged in or working. The local Rogers cable on the 19"tv was so poor you have to sit on the couch to watch tv the bed is just to far. The staff was polite and helpful. The staff should move to a better location where they would be able to hear more then complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: karlburns
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here one night on a layover in Toronto. The hotel is nowhere near new, but the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff were polite, though not terribly warm. The hotel is just minutes from the airport and they had a decent sized complimentary shuttle that was running every 30 minutes. We didn't have breakfast during our stay, but we had dinner in the evening at the adjoining Casey's restaurant. The food was average, but found some of the staff to be snotty. We got a great deal on booking.com and overall it was a pleasant stay. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive layover hotel - will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: TimminsFamily
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with the price, location, cleaniless of this room. It's a great airport hotel and even has a few extras if you're staying for a longer stay. A few small cons: 1. Starting at around 7am, you can hear airplanes taking off from Pearson so if you're a light sleeper or want to sleep in, bring ear plugs and you'll be quite comfortable. 2. The $12/day parking fee is a little steep.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again absolutely !”
Reviews.Author: blondie091
Reviews.Content: I used the Travelodge Dixon Road at YYZ for a stopover before heading down to Mexico the following day on a business trip and couldn't have been more pleased with my choice of an airport hotel. Check in was quick and easy. My room on the 15th floor was clean and spacious with all the amenities I required for this quick stay of apx 13 hours.. The gift shop on the lobby level doesn't sell stamps, strange and would not give me even the smallest of exchange on US currency, needless to say I put things back that I had intended to purchase there. I had a fantastic meal at Casey's, the restaurant onsite. Service and quality of food far exceeded my expectations, try the stacked sandwich and the cocktails were fab in huge glasses with fresh fruit. You are given a 15 % off coupon upon check in at the hotel and I suggest you use it to try this lively and unique bar / restaurant. Shuttle service was on time and dependable, also good drivers who were helpful. I have stayed at alot of airport hotels in YYZ but think I will return to this one in the future over the others I've tried which most cost much more and didn't really give me the value I had hoped for. I had no problem whatsoever with Travelodge Dixon Road, Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “They just don't care.”
Reviews.Author: OntarioRetiree
Reviews.Content: If you want a nights sleep, then DON'T STAY at this place. Noisey, out dated air/heat unit and noisey planes, I will NOT be back. The hotel wasn't at all busy. The front desk personal wanted me to pack up and move to another room, at 4am. Would not give me a quiet room to use, only using the bed. Although the rate was quoted at $89.00, when all the extras are added, parking $12.00, 3 taxes, total came to $115.00. Had to wait for the shuttle bus. The front desk staff need to be re- trained in customer service. Renovated, ha! Deployable towels.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Attendee at CAPS meetings and workshops”
Reviews.Author: Wealthy1
Reviews.Content: Staff attitude: Highly Professional Cleanliness of facilities: Excellent Service: Excellent I have been attending meetings and workshops offered by the Canadian Association of Professional Speakers [CAPS] and have found Travelodge to be a great place. I'm very satisfied with the service.

Reviews.Title: “The most unpleasant stay at the Travelodge at 925 Dixon Road, Toronto, ON M9W 1J8.”
Reviews.Author: EnoughBadService
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Toronto the night before leaving for Mexico, in February. We had the most unpleasant stay. So unpleasant that we cancelled the room for the night we were back from our holiday. Her name is â€˜Sophieâ€™ and she is the most unprofessional, arrogant, and rude desk clerk I have ever met. She was unwilling to help us after we told her that we didnâ€™t have any hot water for our shower. She actually left the front desk and ignored us to go to the back room. What a nice welcome that is. The manager, John, is no better; weaseling is way out of the problem. And donâ€™t try to ask another clerk, they just walk away from you. I canâ€™t believe that Travelodge employs people with no class. In conclusion I will NEVER go back to any Travelodge nor will I ever recommend the hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “great stopover-24hour shuttle”
Reviews.Author: londonwesty
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel once again as a stop over stay prior to early morning flight to Caribbean. Have stayed here on one other occasion and came back it had several things I liked and was looking for. Clean. Efficient. 24 hour free shuttle to airport (some do not start until 5 am or later. Does not help when your flight is at 6:00-6:30am and you need to be at airport at 3:30am) free on site parking for up to 8 days. Close to airport (It's like right there) I can watch planes land in the evening (south facing rooms have great views or southern runways and planes come in from the east) Casey's restaurant on site. Anyway, like this hotel. Stayed here twice now and will go to it once again next year. Stayed Jan 28, 2009 and previously Feb 2, 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here so as to avoid driving to the airport in a severe winter storm as I had an early morning flight. I thought it was a very comfortable hotel. The beds were awesome, hard to get up in the morning.The hotel has a nice lobby but the rooms are very plain and not exactly pretty, but when staying at an airport hotel I don't care about pretty. The pool was clean and well maintained. The restaurant downstairs had great food but was slightly pricey. I had no issues with this hotel and would stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable if a Bit Worn”
Reviews.Author: BlvlTraveller
Reviews.Content: Travel constantly for business and stay here often. While rooms are showing age, the beds are comfortable, a nice work space is provided in rooms and curtains keep it dark and rooms are quiet. In other words, decent for business. Clean. The fitness area is a bit less than ideal but is being renovated along with lobby, so wait and see in the fall I guess. Service is attentive and friendly, and plenty of free parking. Excellent food in the restaurant (on high side of average price) with a nice bar with good selection of European beers (if that's your thing)

Reviews.Title: “great again!”
Reviews.Author: brianboy
Reviews.Content: Another great stay!!! Checked in late Sunday night and the staff did everything to make my stay wonderful. And what a nice room with a king size bed. I have been there 3 times now and would definitely recommend this to any one especially those catching an early flight out of Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Bad.”
Reviews.Author: jgr6b1
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that I like this hotel. It has always been clean, friendly, and has a reliable shuttle restaurant is goo, and there are others around that are good. The pool is clean and It is a good price for stopovers. The bad, this is not a reflection so much on the hotel but rather a systemic problem for all hotels in the aria. When we returned from our flight we discovered that all 4 tires were stolen and our window was smashed. Their long term parking is at the former Regal Constellation, currently closed. There was also a gentleman we that had his radio taken. The hotel was very sorry, comped our room with an upgrade and we very helpful.We are flying out again this may, and we still will stay there it a good place, But I think all should be concerned that the neighborhood has become a haven for car vandalism.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: constantia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Travelodge, as I had to catch an early flight to the US, and wanted someplace close to the airport and reasonably priced. My experience was horrible; I walked into a room with airconditioning blasting, to mask the smell of damp. As well, the bathroom was old with a cracked mirror and mold growing on the top of the shower. All night long I kept hearing a fan, which meant a really lousy night's sleep. I read that the other reviewer liked the 24 hour shuttle. I believed, based on the website, that this is a complimentary service. It is not, it is $6, which is same price as a taxi, and you do not have to stop at every terminal. As a frequent traveller, I have stayed in budget as well as more lavish accomodation... and this would be my worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for a Park n'fly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge on Dixon is excellent for stopovers, which was the goal of my last visit in March. I needed 1-week parking and a room on my return from a holiday in Cuba on a late night flight. All other hotels in the area refused to provide parking before I checked-in and the Travelodge had an excellent park n'fly rate and accepted to do so. If I compare it with the Marriott on the other side of the street (in which I've stayed 3 times) and the Wyndham Bristol Place, they're definately not in the same class even tough they will try to tell you it is... I am mentionning this because other than for a stopover, rates at the Travelodge are equal or sometimes higher than at the Marriott or the Wyndham. But If you're looking for a clean room, efficient staff and just a good night's sleep after a night flight, this is the place. They have truly GREAT mattresses and a 24-hour shuttle to all YYZ's terminals. Other than that, the overall look (rooms, lobby) is cheaper than other surrouding hotels and the pool is about the size of a goldfish pond.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Hotel Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 925 Dixon Road, Toronto, Ontario M9W 1J8, Canada
